data.title: Deserves 2.5 score
data.text: Top gun's best feature is that it is indoors and air conditioned. It is accessible by elevator which might   helpful for those with strollers or walking devices. Most of the floor space is taken up with cheap toys and beach wear. The golf course has 9 holes. They are short and every one has the hole on a small raised platform so it usually means you spend several shots watching rolls down the sides if the platform. The military decor is both cheese and creepy. The only discount is for military. $5 is not bad if you replay the holes. There were only 2 size clubs. Not the best option for fun but I guess there are worse.

data.title: Fun Place to Visit
data.text: I went for a stoll on the boardwalk and decided to visit the arcade not much of a golfer but it was fun to watch others who looked like they enjoyed it.  Definitely will try next time.

data.title: Top Golf
data.text: UNBELIEVABLY FUN!  Top Golf is an experience to be had by all... So much fun.  I didn't want to stop playing!  We went 2 days in a row- both days were freezing but we were never cold.  Had fun hitting balls and playing the numerous golf games!  The food was awesome, the staff was fun and friendly and altogether worth every penny (not over priced ).  Total package.., food, drinks, and total fun!

data.title: Terrible
data.text: What a disappointment. All the courses were pretty much the same and short, it was run down. It has some cheesy military mannequins and war room related props. Maybe the owners have good intentions, but this place is such a disappointment. Don't waste your money and time.

data.title: Underwelming
data.text:
This is a 9 hole course that you can't help but laugh about. The "military" mannequins, "rockets", and set pieces are very quaintly homemade looking. 

The courses isn't actually as easy as it look because the holes are on little mounds so it take a bit of precision to get a good score. It's fun to play a hole where on the other side of a mountain of boxes there are t-shirts and flip flops as this is also a souvenir store. 

The value is good because they'll let you play the holes twice and it's convenient if you need a t-shirt afterwards. We didn't play the arcade but we saw same games in the  corner that would count. 

All in all, don't be too serious about a mini golf experience if you're going here.

data.title: This place was no where near as good as the other putt putt places in VA Beach
data.text: I have been to several putt putt golf attractions in VA Beach, and this is the worse. It's really a joke compared to the others... the only benefit I can see is it is indoors. My family will not be back.

data.title: Putt Putt Golf
data.text: Travelled in 1992 lol too old of a review. I am a putt putt golf lover :^D Lots of fun on this course.

data.title: How do you get in?
data.text:
We went by this twice and couldn't figure out how to get into it.
It's on the second floor of a building and we could see all the paint on the outside and see some of the games through the windows but we couldn't find the damn entrance.

data.title: Got Us Out Of The Cold
data.text: It was a fun way to kill an hour and get us out of the cold temperature and wind. Not the best mini golf I have ever played but we had fun playing and we were the only ones on the course until the very end. We played a few games in the arcade but each game was at least 2 quarters and most were $1.00. They do offer a military discount for the golf, which is always appreciated.

data.title: Great little spot for a Birthday party
data.text: We held my son's 8th Birthday there.  The kids had a great time!  Small enough that they could hang out and see everyone.  Unlike many larger venues, I paid for those that showed, not in advance for those that were no-shows!  Parents are on their own to wrangle for cake, keep score, and dole out quarters for the arcade.  Bring friends to help

data.title: good thing to do if there's not a lot of people
data.text: I wouldn't do this if there were a lot of people. It was a decent little indoor course. I didn't realize there was an arcade in there, we didn't do any of the arcade stuff... but the mini golf took up some of the time outa the day. We also are pretty quick mini golfers and don't spend a lot of time thinking and trying to get the perfect shot.

data.title: Bare bones
data.text: Not much thought went into the displays and they are quite old and falling apart. My 4-year-old had never played mini-golf before and had a great time but she had nothing to compare it to. Veterans should stay away and mini golf at one of the more well appointed courses.  Upside?  It is indoors and well-air conditioned.

data.title: Worst mini golf course
data.text: This is by far the worst mini golf course I have ever played.  Every hole is surrounded by an elevated circle that makes it extremely hard for younger golfers.  None of us even came close to a hole in one.  Plus I don't understand the concept of putting a flag in every hole.  They were so annoying.  There are two better outdoor courses nearby.

data.title: Waste of  money and time
data.text: I wanted to take my boys to an arcade and golf, and I ran into this place. I would never go there again. They had about 5 "arcade games" and the indoor golf was a waste of money. Not to mention the kid working there was not very friendly or helpful. My 8 year old son who has an Autism spectrum disorder was so happy to tell the kid working there that "he beat his mom at Minnie golf" and the kid completely ignored him. Not a good way to run a business.

data.title: Limited selection
data.text: Not very many games for an arcade. As a family of 4 we spent $10 in about 20 minutes- taking turns.

data.title: If it's raining...
data.text: This is an indoor mini golf.  I have to say the course is average at best.  Not much to look at.  There is a small arcade there.  It's an okay place to go if it's pouring!

data.title: So much fun
data.text: My family and I absolutely loved this mini golf game. It is extremely large and not overcrowded at all. I'd only recommend it if one really enjoys mini golf because I feel like it takes a long time to complete one game

data.title: A joke to charge
data.text: This is the worst mini golf I have EVER played... and I have played alot. The place isn't kept up, the greens are torn and ragged, and I'd have more fun mowing a flat patch in my own yard, and putting into a cup dug out with an ice cream scoop. But if you eat the "Rainbow Jelly Beans" from the RainBow Man on the beach first, you will laugh your butt off at the crazy stuff there and not mind the smell of urine at all!

data.title: This Place SUCKS!
data.text: Worst Putt Putt golf course ever...  The entire place is flat and boring, every hole is the same, the scenery is poorly made, the sounds effects are terrible, and it is the most expensive at the beach.   I would rather die than go to this awful place ever again!!!!  Great place to go if you want to see the worst putt putt golf course in the whole entire world.
